Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Crupti> @jimboscott And what's UTXO?

Author: bishop#9773
Content: Unspent Transaction Output

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrdvrsc] <jimboscott> I was cleaning up my wallet this morning in order to consolidate some transactions for better staking.  This is what it did to my GUI wallet...
https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/449638035999686677/482936924705652748/unknown.png

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Crupti> @Matterbridge I just changed address prior to transferring the 0.01, but I can change again I guess.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jimboscott> 4 out of 5 of those are something I did not do specifically...

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jimboscott> UTXO - Unspent Transaction Output

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Crupti> @jimboscott And where does that unknown public key come from as its not on my address list but still validates with my private key.

Author: bishop#9773
Content: since no one listens, Jimbo, you got this

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jimboscott> @Crupti Your wallet creates new public keys.  This is not like a QT Wallet coin where you have to do that yourself.  The wallet starts with a pool of public keys (and, of course, the private keys for them).  But it will also create new keys on the fly.  These get used for your 'change'.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jimboscott> So if I have 100 VRSC in one UTXO and send 50 to a different address - it seems that is the same thing as pulling a 100 dollar bill out - leaving the address that held it, then splitting it.  The change comes BACK to me, but at a different address.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jimboscott> In real life, it comes back to my WIFE's wallet about 100% of the time.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Crupti> @jimboscott ðŸ˜‰ Ok, thanks for answering.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jimboscott> I really wish there was a way to clean the wallet up so that all of the little details did not clutter things up...  but as long as your balance is right then all should be well.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jimboscott> @arton The issue with the fork was not foreseen.  It coincided with the creation of pools and the release of the new wallet.  Sort of a perfect storm.   In retrospect it should have been mandatory.  But nobody could see clearly enough into the future to make that call prior to its release.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Crupti> Another thing I wanted to bring up is _transaction times_. I'm not proud of it, but I have dabbled with Ripple XRP and EOS for some time, and their transactions take less that 1 minute to confirm. I know that it's technically hard to compete with those blockchains with a *truly* distributed blockchain like this, but two hours is a very long time for a transaction imo. Is there any worked being done on this issue?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jimboscott> @Crupti It does not take 2 hours for me to send coins to you.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jimboscott> Or for you to send to me.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jimboscott> It takes two hours (a little less actually) to confirm a mined block - unless you are having wallet issues.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jimboscott> @Crupti shoot me a public T address - I will send you a VRSC

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jimboscott> Let's see how long before it is confirmed in your wallet

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Crupti> @jimboscott That may be so, but in reality people don't get their money until 1-2 hours. I experimented today by sending 0.01 coins to my exchange, that was 48 minutes ago and it's still not available for trading with 113/120 confirmations.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jimboscott> OHHH.... an exchange.   There's your problem.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jimboscott> The exchange is setting the rules.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jimboscott> Not Verus

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Crupti> @jimboscott Ok, so more confirmations needed with an exchange then, I gather?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jimboscott> Just because the exchange says so.  They may be creating a big lag in order to stake their balance.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jimboscott> Just sent you 1 VRSC, BTW

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Crupti> @jimboscott Thanks, very nice of you ðŸ˜„

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jimboscott> Let me know when your balance ticks up

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Crupti> Ok, I'll send it back once I'e gotten it confirmed on my side.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jimboscott> And, the UTXO it came from was a 3.2 VRSC payment from a pool.   My available balance just went DOWN 3.2 VRSC - but when you get your 1,  I will get 2.2 back in change.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jimboscott> Probably to an address that no human has ever seen before.
